metadata.name: Potential Suspicious PowerShell Module File Created
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module in the first folder of the module directory structure "\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\malware\malware.psm1". This is somewhat an uncommon practice as legitimate modules often includes a version folder.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\windowspowershell\\modules*\\.ps')) OR endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\windowspowershell\\modules*\\.dll'))))

output.summary: Detects the creation of a new PowerShell module in the first folder of the module directory structure "\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\malware\malware.psm1". This is somewhat an uncommon practice as legitimate modules often includes a version folder.

metadata.objective: False positive: False positive rate will vary depending on the environments. Additional filters might be required to make this logic usable in production. References: Internal Research, https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/scripting/developer/module/understanding-a-windows-powershell-module?view=powershell-7.3
